mainEntity.name: Which devices and apps are supported?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Kindle, Kobo, PocketBook, Vivlio, Onyx Boox, Bookeen Cybook, KOReader, GoldenDict, Plato, ColorDict, FlowDict, and more.
Our dictionaries work with virtually every major e-reader and dictionary app.

mainEntity.name: Is native PocketBook/Vivlio dictionary support available?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Native dictionary installation on PocketBook and Vivlio devices is not available yet due to technical limitations. However, you can use our dictionaries on these devices by installing KOReader, which provides full support.
We are actively working on a solution for native support and will update our users when it becomes available. For guidance or updates, contact us!

mainEntity.name: How do I install my dictionary?

acceptedAnswer.text:
Easy, step-by-step instructions for each device:
  • Kobo: Copy dicthtml-XX-YY.zip to .kobo/custom-dict/ (no need to unzip).
  • Kindle: Unzip dict-XX-YY.mobi.zip, then move dict-XX-YY.mobi to documents/dictionaries/.
  • KOReader: Unzip dict-XX-YY.zip, copy files to koreader/data/dict/ (see device-specific paths in full instructions).

mainEntity.name: What file formats do you provide?

acceptedAnswer.text:
DICT.org, DictFile, DictHTML, MobiPocket, and StarDict.
Choose the format that works best for your device or app.

acceptedAnswer.text: We offer a simple, one-time price for each dictionary, no matter its current size.
